title: Tuple and Set Concept Map
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Computer Science
description: Interactive concept map of list, tuple, set, and frozenset relationships with shared properties and set operations.

educational.topic: Tuples, Sets, and Related Collection Types
learningObjectives: Students will be able to summarize relationships between tuples, sets, frozensets, and lists by exploring connected properties in a concept map.

pedagogical.teachingStrategy: Interactive concept mapping with hover-based relationship highlighting
keyQuestions: Why are immutable types valid dictionary keys?
What properties are shared by set and frozenset?
commonMisconceptions: Tuples and sets both preserve insertion order in all contexts
All collections can be used as dictionary keys
assessmentOpportunities: Summarize similarities and differences among collection types
